newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Jan crude palm oil output down 9.57 pct.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Jan crude palm oil output down 9.57 pct.

text.p: Malaysia's crude palm oil output fell 9.57 percent to 576,967 tonnes in January from 638,045 in December, the Palm Oil Registration and Licensing Authority (PORLA) said on Saturday.
It said end-January palm oil stocks were 696,272 tonnes against 794,454 at end-December.
January palm oil exports were 551,665 tonnes against 652,874 in December, PORLA said.
PORLA said Peninsular Malaysia's crude palm oil output fell 10.95 percent to 411,985 tonnes in January from 462,985 in December and 446,989 in January 1996.
Output from east Malaysian states of Sabah and Sarawak fell 5.93 percent to 164,982 tonnes in January from 175,387 in December and against 119,387 in January 1996
Malaysia's palm kernel oil production dropped 14.02 percent to 84,875 tonnes in January from 98,712 in December and against 94,040 in January 1996.

Stocks of crude palm oil at end-January were 356,063 tonnes, against 435,414 at end-December and 494, 599 a year earlier. Processed palm oil stocks totalled 340,209 tonnes compared with 359,040 and 331,755 respectively, PORLA said.

Stocks of crude palm kernel oil were 47,421 tonnes at end-January against 59,887 at end-December and 56,247 at end-January 1996. Processed palm kernel oil stocks were 49,768 tonnes compared with 49,329 and 43,369 respectively.
